H0.text: Ethylene is the compound whose synthesis is inhibited by carbon dioxide, while circulating air prevents ethylene from accumulating.

H1.text: Alcohol is the compound whose synthesis is inhibited by carbon dioxide, while circulating the air prevents ethylene from accumulating.

H2.text: Sulfur is the new synthesis that carbon dioxide inhibits, while circulating the air prevents ethylene from accumulating.

H3.text: Cellulose is the new compound whose synthesis is inhibited by carbon dioxide, while circulating the air prevents ethylene from accumulating.

A4.text: Carbon dioxide 'burners' and the exhaust fumes from inefficient glasshouse heaters can raise the ethylene concentration to 0.05 ppmv

A5.text: Hormonal root pruning theory â€“ in the new theory just like ethylene, GA, BA and Eth are seen both to be induced by sugar (GA/BA) and oxygen (ETH) shortages (as well as maybe excess levels of carbon dioxide for Eth) in the roots, and to push sugar and oxygen, as well as minerals, water and the growth hormones out of the root cell causing a positive feedback loop resulting in the emptying and death of the root cell.
